intro: Chromatotriccum brachycalyptra, commonly known as the narrow-capped rock cress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, annual herbaceous plant that typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant features simple, linear leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a short, cylindrical silique that contains several seeds. Chromatotriccum brachycalyptra is adapted to arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
